intro: Nesaea palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's nesaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Nesaea palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
